intro: Theophrasta latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved theophrasta, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apocynaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its large, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white to yellowish flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a warm, humid climate to flourish. Theophrasta latifolia is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral display.
